body_html: I am removing myself. I did some internal testing and opened bugs for @gunan . We did get 7.0 added to the default builds. I think we cannot accept this change because our compute versions are not guaranteed to be contiguous. One solution looking at the build code is to look to see if the compute capabilities are contiguous and execute one path and if there is a break execute the other path. I opened an issue asking the team to evaluate the size difference of doing them all contiguous vs. picking just the ones we wanted. Meaning is picking more expensive then doing them all correctly.

I opened an issue asking the team to evaluate the size difference of doing them all contiguous vs. picking just the ones we wanted. Meaning is picking more expensive then doing them all correctly.
body: I am removing myself.  I did some internal testing and opened bugs for @gunan .  We did get 7.0 added to the default builds.  I think we cannot accept this change because our compute versions are not guaranteed to be contiguous.  One solution looking at the build code is to look to see if the compute capabilities are contiguous and execute one path and if there is a break execute the other path.  I opened an issue asking the team to evaluate the size difference of doing them all contiguous vs. picking just the ones we wanted. Meaning is picking more expensive then doing them all correctly.
